full_summary:
**Victoria Class Capstan Spares Tender**
======================================

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01009120

**Solicitation Number:** W8482-230900/A

**Publication Date:** October 5, 2022

**Tender Closing Date:** November 25, 2022, 2:00 PM EST

**Contracting Entity:** Department of National Defence

**Procurement Category:** Goods (G)

**Notice Description:**

The Department of National Defence invites interested bidders to submit a proposal for the supply of various capstan spares for the Victoria Class submarines. The items required are detailed below.

* **GSIN Code:** 4730, 5305, 5310, 5320, 5330, 5331, 5340, 5355
* **NSN Number:** Various
* **Quantity:** 203 items, as detailed in the attached tender document

**Delivery Locations:**

* Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Esquimalt
* CFB Halifax

**Language:**

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada, English or French.

**Instructions to Bidders:**

* The tender closes on November 25, 2022, 2:00 PM EST.
* Bidders must submit their proposals electronically through the Canada Buys website.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Contact Information:**

* Name: Kurtis Craney-Plouffe
* Email: [KURTIS.CRANEY-PEUFFE@forces.gc.ca](mailto:KURTIS.CRANEY-PEUFFE@forces.gc.ca)
* Phone: 819-939-3059

**Attachments:**

* Annex A: List of required items and specifications
* Contract document: Varies by language (English or French)

Note: The original text was rewritten while keeping all the relevant information intact, but condensing it to meet the 400-word limit. Minor formatting changes were made for readability. The text was formatted in Markdown format with headings and bullet points to improve clarity.  The text was also reviewed for grammatical errors and made to sound more professional.  The English translation was reviewed to ensure accuracy.  The original translation of headings and text was retained.    No optional or non-essential information was included.  Redundant information was removed. The overall tone and style was kept formal and professional as
